attributes.action: Allow Arriva to take over Network Warrington Bus Company
attributes.additional_details:
According to the Guardian, 85% of the votes of the reason why the numbers are falling on Network Warrington is too expensive, Second place is unreliable at 7%.
A number of people are calling for a bus company to take over Network Warrington. The majority of which is Arriva. 
Network Warrington charges £5.95 for a day travel using any Network Warrington while Arrive charges £5.30 for the whole of the north west day travel. Including using some Stagecoach and Halton Transport.
Arriva would be the best option serving Warrington
attributes.background: Network Warrington is a overpriced bus company. Bus fares has gone up twice in over 6 months in 2015, Number of service withdrawn upsetting the passengers who rely them to get to work, school and college and it shows the number of passengers using Network Warrington has dropped dramatically.

rejection.details:
Your petition should be addressed to Warrington Borough Council, which owns Network Warrington:
https://www.warrington.gov.uk/
